task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 238°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building height, I need to see the roofline and base clearly, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading toward the building.
The view is now facing north/up and likely not centered on the target building at ~238°, so I should rotate back toward the southwest while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
I need both the building base and roof in view to estimate height, so I should first tilt up to include the top portion while staying aimed at 238°.
The heading has reset to 0° again, so I must rotate to face the target building direction (~238°) while keeping pitch up to see the roofline.
To estimate height I need a stable view of the building including its top; since pitch keeps resetting, I'll move closer to make the façade fill the frame for easier story-count estimation.
I’m now facing NW and need to re-aim toward the target building direction (SW ~238°), so I should rotate left to about 238°.
I’m still not aligned with the intended SW direction (~238°), so I should rotate further left by about 47° to face the building more directly.
The heading has jumped back to 313°; to face the target at ~238° I should rotate left by about 75°.
Since rotations aren’t holding the view toward 238°, I should move forward-right to change position and get a clearer, more centered view of the main building façade for height estimation.
